intro: Sisyrinchium brayi, commonly known as the bray's blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, bright blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Sisyrinchium brayi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it an important species in its native range.
